thread.title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Bond Rout, Swiss Franc, Gene Simmons

author: WSJ Staff
title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Bond Rout, Swiss Franc, Gene Simmons
text: The combination of expected higher short-term rates and falling 10-year bond yields has rekindled discussion in the markets and at the Fed of the gap between the two, and whether we should be worrying about imminent recession, writes James Mackintosh. When Jerome Powell was sworn in as Federal Reserve chairman in February, investors were almost   WSJ City: UBS Posts a Profit Rise, Traders Worry About Liquidity, Why the Flattening Yield Curve Isn't Just the Fed's Problem Next Stronger U.S. Dollar Halts Oil's Riseâ€”Energy Journal
